Articles.Content:
I'm sure this post will get moved but I hope it doesn't because I'd like people to actually see it lol. Anyway I'm having this duplication/explosion bug with remote tech 2 ... I've seen that other people are having it and there is a community made "hotfix" linked on the space port page that doesn't work. Does anybody know of a solution? Obviously not everyone is having this problem ....

Here is a quick video showing the bug.

http://youtu.be/DPAOc4W3w_I

Edited March 25, 2014 by Renaissance0321

what you can do as a temporary fix is to go into your persistence file and delete all the duplicate craft. Also if you check the Remote Tech thread here on the forum you will find the hotfix. (I linked the direct post) you must have RemoteTech 2 installed to use it.
This is a known issue. You'll have more luck if you post this in the RT2 thread.
I tried that hotfix and it didn't work. The video taken above was after I installed the hotfix. How would I go about deleting the craft? I don't want to mess anything up.
Ah disregard I was able to delete the duplicates through the tracking station.

I have RT2 installed as well. First thing I do every time I start playing is hit the tracking station and check for duplicates.

If I'm docking something (parts for my science station, for instance) I will always switch to to the craft outside of texture loading distance, then back to tug. Helps keeps things from rapidly disassembling.
